structure.unit: ARTICLE XIIA. WORKFORCE HOUSING DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM

text.section:
Sec. 33-193.11. Intensity standards.
Notwithstanding zoning district regulations to the contrary, the following maximum intensity standards shall apply to applications seeking approval of a WHU application that provides either the WHUs required to obtain a density bonus or a monetary contribution in lieu thereof, under the provision of this Article:
In the EU-2 District:
Minimum lot size—Four (4) acres;
Minimum lot frontage—One hundred sixty-five (165) feet;
Maximum lot coverage—Twenty (20) percent.
In the EU-1C District:
Minimum lot size—Two (2) acres;
Minimum lot frontage—One hundred twenty-five (125) feet.
In the EU-1 District:
Minimum lot size—Thirty-two thousand five hundred (32,500) square feet;
Minimum lot frontage—One hundred ten (110) feet.
In the EU-S District:
Minimum lot size—Twenty thousand (20,000) square feet;
Minimum lot frontage—One hundred ten (110) feet.
In the EU-M District:
Minimum lot size—Twelve thousand five hundred (12,500) square feet;
Minimum lot frontage—One hundred (100) feet.
In the RU-1 and RU-2 Districts:
Minimum net lot area of residential lots shall be 5,000 square feet and the minimum lot frontage shall be 50 feet, except that a maximum of 10 percent of the residential lots may be reduced to a minimum of 4,000 square feet and a minimum lot frontage of 40 feet; and
Maximum lot coverage shall not exceed the lot coverage permitted by the underlying district regulations by more than 20%.
In the RU-1M(a), and RU-1M(b) Districts:
The minimum net lot area of residential lots shall be 4,000 square feet; and the minimum lot frontage shall be 40 feet; and
Maximum lot coverage shall not exceed the lot coverage permitted by the underlying district regulations by more than 20%.
In the RU-TH district:
Minimum lot size shall be 1,250 square feet of net lot area; and
Minimum open space shall be 20 percent of the net lot area.
In the RU-RH district:
Minimum lot size shall be 1,000 square feet of net lot area; and
Density shall not exceed 15 dwelling units per net acre; and
No private open space shall be required; and
A minimum of 10 percent common open space shall be provided in the way of greens.
In the RU-3M district:
Maximum floor area ratio shall be 0.60; and'
Maximum height shall be 3 stories not to exceed 40 feet in overall height; and
Maximum lot coverage shall be 35% of net lot area; and
Minimum open space shall be 20 percent of the net land area.
In the RU-4L district:
Maximum floor area ratio shall be 0.9;
Maximum height shall be 6 stories;
Maximum lot coverage shall be 35% of net lot area.
In the RU-4M district:
Maximum floor area ratio shall be 1.0;
Maximum height shall be 9 stories;
Maximum lot coverage shall be 35% of net lot area.
In the RU-4 and RU-4A districts:
Maximum height shall be one additional story;
Maximum floor area ratio shall be 2.2 for a development over 9 stories.
In the BU-1 and BU-1A districts if approved after public hearing:
Maximum floor area ratio — Add .015 per acre above that permitted by the district regulations;
Maximum lot coverage shall be 45% of net lot area;
Landscaped open space shall be the open space percentage required by the underlying district regulations for a one story building.
In the BU-2 district if approved after public hearing:
Maximum floor area ratio — Add .015 per acre above that permitted by the district regulations
Maximum lot coverage shall be 50% of net lot area;
Landscaped open space shall be the open space percentage required by the underlying district regulations for a one story building.
In all transit corridor areas, parking shall be provided as required by section 33-124 of this code, except as follows:
the minimum parking required shall be:
Residential—One (1) parking space per dwelling unit.
Office—One (1) parking space per four-hundred (400) square feet of gross floor area.
Hotel—One (1) parking space for every two (2) guest rooms.
Severable use rights, as provided in Chapter 33B of this code, shall not be utilized in conjunction with the intensity standards contained in this article.
